title: Ticket #2300: Cluster id rollover and schedd restart cause "ERROR JOB QUEUE DAMAGED"
description:
When cluster id rolls over and schedd restarts, it can have the following message in SchedLog and schedd cannot be started: 

06/30/11 18:42:43 (pid:24166) ERROR "JOB QUEUE DAMAGED; header ad
NEXT_CLUSTER_NUM invalid" at line 932 in file qmgmt.cpp


Steps to Reproduce:
1. set "SCHEDD_CLUSTER_MAXIMUM_VALUE=9"
2. condor_submit 9 jobs that are not runnable by any systems, so that they can
stay in the queue.
3. Use condor_rm to remove job 1, 2 and 3
4. Use condor_submit to submit a new job, which will have roll-over and become
job 1. The NextClusterNum in job_queue.log will be 2.
5. Use condor_rm to remove job 9
6. Wait until job log rotate. (that the removed job 9, 2, 3 will be
disappeared in the new job_queue.log) (use QUEUE_CLEAN_INTERVAL = 60)
7. Restart condor.

In InitJobQueue (qmgmt.cpp), It will calculate the highest cluster_num and then it will hit this checking because stored_cluster_num is 2 because of the roll-over. 

        if ( next_cluster_num > stored_cluster_num ) {
            // Oh no!  Somehow the header ad in the queue says to reuse cluster
nums!
            EXCEPT("JOB QUEUE DAMAGED; header ad NEXT_CLUSTER_NUM invalid");
        }

Actual results: It will show 'ERROR "JOB QUEUE DAMAGED; header ad NEXT_CLUSTER_NUM invalid" at line 932 in file qmgmt.cpp'

Expected results: It will start normally and it can use the NextClusterNum specified.
remarks:
2011-Aug-04 14:35:36 by gthain:
What's the use case for the maximum cluster value?

2011-Aug-04 15:06:07 by eje:
As I understand it, the use case is customers who want to guarantee that their cluster ids stay <= some maximum size because their in-house data warehousing/analysis tools do not work properly on larger cluster numbers.
attachments:
• gt2300-max-cluster-error.patch 826 bytes added by eje on 2011-Jul-13 19:34:13 UTC.
    Patch disables consistency check on cluster id when SCHEDD_CLUSTER_MAXIMUM_VALUE is configured, since wrapped cluster ids are a valid state in this case.
check_ins: 2011-Jul-13 14:46   Check-in [22449]: ===VersionHistory=== Disabled scheduler exception on check for wrapped cluster ids when SCHEDD_CLUSTER_MAXIMUM_VALUE is set, since in that case wrapped ids are a valid state. ===GT:Fixed=== #2300 (By Erik Erlandson )
creator: eje
